image.altText: Robert with grandkids

items.synopsis: Robert Taylor has lived in Australia since he was a baby but is facing deportation after being convicted for aggravated burglary. There are calls for him to be allowed to die with his family beside him.

title.children: Terminally ill man facing deportation after criminal conviction pleads to spend his last days at home

image.altText: A group photo of Cameron Caldwell with supporters cheering

items.synopsis: Labor candidate Letitia Del Fabbro tells supporters on the Gold Coast that she has called LNP candidate Cameron Caldwell and congratulated him on his victory.

title.children: LNP candidate Cameron Caldwell claims victory in the Fadden by-election

image.altText: A composite image of an older woman next to her younger self, with an scar in the shape of an X on her forehead.

items.synopsis: Leslie Van Houten entered prison as a fresh-faced 19-year-old, devoted to notorious cult leader Charles Manson. This week the 73-year-old walked free.

title.children: Nineteen, brainwashed, and tripping on LSD: How a murderer found freedom from a cult behind bars

image.altText: A young woman stands outside holding two children: a little boy with a green toy and a toddler in pink shirt

items.synopsis: Just across a dry riverbed from the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant lies the Ukrainian town of Nikopol. Despite the Kakhovka dam attack cutting off their water supply and constant shelling from Russia, they say they won't be driven away.

title.children: Russia's war in Ukraine left Oksana's family without drinking water. That could be the least of their worries

image.altText: The poster shows a woman yelling at a healthcare worker, a gurney with a child on it between them.

items.synopsis: Government workers have been driven at, verbally abused and threatened, and the rate of those incidents has only gone up, the ACT government says.

title.children: 'I was called every name under the sun': Acts of abuse towards Canberra's public sector workers on the rise

image.altText: Marketa Vondrousova holds up a plate-shaped golden trophy and smiles

items.synopsis: Twenty-four-year-old Marketa Vondrousa defeats Ons Jabeur in straight sets to become the first unseeded player to win the Wimbledon women's singles title in the professional era.

title.children: Vondrousova shocks Jabeau to become lowest ranked women's Wimbledon winner in history

image.altText: Reclink (1)

items.synopsis: From Melbourne to Brisbane and Hobart to Fremantle, musicians and media gather every year to kick a footy for a cause — and it was all started on the streets of St Kilda.

title.children: Prime ministers, popes and Paul Kelly — how a kick-to-kick 30 years ago led to a national footy phenomenon

image.altText: Cars wait in bumper to bumper morning traffic on a busy road

items.synopsis: Australians love big cars, and it's undoing the good work of the shift to more electric and hybrid vehicles.

title.children: Australia is obsessed with big cars, and it’s a problem

image.altText: A police officer on a motorbike.

items.synopsis: SA Police say a 51-year-old man is in custody after surrendering from the house.

title.children: Woman dies, another seriously injured, after siege at Campbelltown in Adelaide's east

image.altText: A number of police detectives and uniformed officers walk through a grassy field

items.synopsis: A 51-year-old man is in police custody following the incident in the Northern Territory town.

title.children: Woman dies at Alice Springs bush camp after alleged assault with a 'blunt weapon'

image.altText: A composite image of a woman sitting down smiling and smiling on the beach

items.synopsis: You only need to get a screening for breast cancer when you're older, right? We break down everything to do with mammograms and with the help of these experts, bust some myths about them.

title.children: Are mammograms for older women? Jess was 27 when she was diagnosed with breast cancer

image.altText: Actress Susan Sarandon smiles as she wears red sunglasses and a blue shirt

items.synopsis: Academy-Award winner Susan Sarandon joins the chorus of striking Hollywood actors warning about the growing threat of artificial intelligence, saying that AI could use "my face, my body and my voice" without permission.

title.children: 'We need to deal with AI now': Susan Sarandon says striking actors deserve new contract for new business

image.altText: L-R: Matt Corby, Meg Mac, Flume

items.synopsis: Look back on our countdown of the 100 most popular triple j Like A Version's of all time!

title.children: DMA's Cher cover takes out triple j's first ever Hottest 100 Like a Version

image.altText: A woman with short red hair and black glasses stands in front of a woman with blonde hair and a pink blazer

items.synopsis: The novel synthetic opioid protonitazine has been detected in Victoria, Queensland, and most recently in South Australia, where health authorities have linked it to an Adelaide man's death and multiple overdoses.

title.children: A 'lethal' new drug is alarming health officials in Australia. Here's what we know about protonitazene

image.altText: a man at a construction site where a house is being built

items.synopsis: About 100 projects were submitted by developers to the Rezoning Pathways Pilot— a controversial scheme initiated by the former state government.

title.children: NSW government reveals five suburbs where thousands of homes will be fast-tracked

image.altText: The booking image of Rex Heuermann. He is a middle-aged white man, with short brown hair, blue eyes and a wide square jaw.

items.synopsis: An architect has been charged with the murder of three out of 11 victims in the long-unsolved Gilgo Beach murders, after US detectives matched DNA from a pizza he ate to genetic material found on the women's remains.

title.children: Suspected Long Island serial killer arrested in decade-old mystery case

image.altText: A photo of Lisa Marie Presley at an award ceremony. She's got long brown hair, blue eyes, and she's wearing a glittery dress.

items.synopsis: Lisa Marie Presley died after developing a small bowel obstruction — a severe complication of bariatric surgery years ago — according to the autopsy report. Experts say these types of complications are a known but rare risk.

title.children: How Lisa Marie Presley's weight loss surgery contributed to her death

image.altText: Pita Limjaroenrat gestures with his hands as he speaks in parliament

items.synopsis: After losing an initial vote for prime minister, the leader of the election-winning Move Forward Party said he would ask the Pheu Thai party to lead the government if he lost a second vote for the top job.

title.children: Thai election winner Pita open to coalition ally leading government if he fails PM bid

items.synopsis: A Swiss-French artist has used biodegradable paint to create two giant frescoes of children sketching how they see the world around them in the Swiss village of Villars-sur-Ollon.

title.children: Artist uses Swiss mountain slopes as his canvas for massive frescoes

image.altText: A decorative Japanese roof

items.synopsis: Built in Japan, shipped to Brisbane and later purchased for just 600 pounds, the building has no windows and removable walls – but its owners can't imagine living anywhere else.

title.children: How a 135-year-old traditional Japanese house became a family home in a small Queensland town

image.altText: Wearing white, Pope Francis waves from balcony during religious service

items.synopsis: The Vatican and China have a 2018 pact to stop a bishop not recognised by the Holy See being installed.

title.children: Pope approves new bishop of Shanghai as Vatican chides China for violating deal

image.altText: A damaged boat at port.

items.synopsis: Xavier Doerr says he set out on Wednesday night with the crew of Port Lincoln prawn vessel FV Challenge to locate and retrieve the yacht, and arrived back in Port Lincoln on Saturday morning.

title.children: Rescued sailor retrieves damaged yacht from the ocean with help from SA fishermen

image.altText: An stlised illustration showing hands around a crystal ball with the words "p/doom" inside it.

items.synopsis: Why some AI experts are beginning to worry about the apocalypse.

title.children: It started as a dark in-joke. It could also be one of the most important questions facing humanity

image.altText: a man standing outdoors with his arms folded looking a the camera

items.synopsis: As the NSW government pushes for more housing density in Sydney, questions about the quality of new apartment buildings have re-emerged after major developer Toplace went into administration.

title.children: The game of 'Russian roulette' facing Sydney apartment buyers

image.altText: A woman in white gloves adjusts a Birkin bag on a shelf

items.synopsis: From the Hermès Birkin to the Chanel classic flap, some are seeking out breathtakingly expensive handbags. But the bags aren't just status symbols — they can also be a savvy investment.

title.children: This bag costs $15,000. To buy it, you have to play an expensive, years-long game of cat and mouse

image.altText: A Geelong AFL player points a finger on his left hand as he celebrates a goal against Essendon.

items.synopsis: Defending premier Geelong thrashes Essendon, while GWS scores a massive victory on the road with its defeat of Adelaide. Earlier, Carlton ended Port Adelaide's 13-match winning run, and Collingwood and Gold Coast also tasted success.

title.children: Cats, Giants enjoy contrasting victories as Blues halt Power's winning streak

image.altText: Melbourne Storm's Xavier Coates jumps for a ball over Sydney Roosters' Fetalaiga Pauga at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

items.synopsis: Xavier Coates scores his second hat-trick against the Roosters this year, capping off a 30-16 win for the Storm at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

title.children: Xavier Coates completes hat-trick with classic SCG hanger as Storm take down Roosters

image.altText: Three Wallabies players look dejected during a Test match against the Pumas.

items.synopsis: A try in the shadows of full-time gives the Michael Cheika-coached Argentina a 34-31 victory, consigning Eddie Jones's Wallabies to a second consecutive defeat in The Rugby Championship.

title.children: Wallabies slump to another loss as Cheika’s Pumas triumph in dramatic finish

image.altText: Aid workers deliver relief material using floatation devices in flood waters.

items.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of people are forced to evacuate amid intense monsoon rains that have killed more than 200 people across Asia.

title.children: Hundreds killed as monsoon rain causes flooding and landslides across Asia

image.altText: A picture of a woman in a yellow and green image.

items.synopsis: Alkina Edwards knew she was watching something special when Indigenous player Donnell Wallam made her debut with the Australian Diamonds last year. What she didn't know was the game would change her life too.

title.children: First Nations artist designs Diamonds' World Cup uniform after powerful artwork goes viral

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: Bright, colourful flowers bloom under a dome net in a row, a small child is bent over looking in a bucket next to the row

items.synopsis: Twenty years after cheap flower imports flooded the Australian market, the focus is back on locally grown blooms as shoppers "push towards sustainability".

title.children: Cheap imports 'decimated' Australia's flower industry. Could micro farms save it?
